name: GrayLog
description:
Greylog is built to open standards, Graylogâ€™s connectivity and interoperability seamlessly collects, enhances, stores, and analyzes log data.
Easily create custom dashboards to visualize a variety of metrics and trends on a single page.
Analyze data and find issues quickly with the ability to explore multiple attack vectors at once. 
Prevent data loss with the Graylog message journal in case of a network outage.
Use the Graylog Sidecar to manage flexible and stackable configurations for all log collectors, both Graylog and third-party, from one central interface. 
#### License:
*   General Public License v3.0
#### Hardware Requirement:
* By default 2vCPU, 4 GB RAM.
#### Resources Installed:
* MongoDB
* Elasticsearch
* GrayLog
#### Operating System:
* CentOS Linux release 7.6.1810
* Select the [AMI](https://goo.gl/td2eJJ) according to the region on AWS.
* Select the [Image](https://goo.gl/51oD7D) according to the zone on GCP.
* Select the [Image](https://goo.gl/KZAjE6) according to the location on Azure.
#### Platform:
* AHV
* AWS
* GCP
* Azure
* VMware
#### Lifecycle:
* NA
#### Limitations:
* Single VM GrayLog Instance. HA not available.
* Not recommended for the production use. 
#### Other Instructions:
* Open port 80 and 9000 under Firewall/Security group.
author: Nutanix
